message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AR, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.DB 

The paper discusses the security and persistence of data in Non-Volatile Memories (NVMs), which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses optimizations and trade-offs for performance and recovery time, which could fall under computer architecture (cs.AR) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). The paper also mentions the need for secure persistence in large capacity NVM systems, which could fall under systems and control (cs.SY) and databases (cs.DB).
